documentType: Bureau of Prisons incident report and staff memoranda
summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons Form 583 Report of Incident and associated staff memoranda detailing the events of July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It reports a possible suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein and includes his allegations that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, attempted to kill him and extort money. Multiple staff accounts describe finding Epstein with a makeshift noose and his subsequent medical evaluation and placement on suicide watch. This document set contains Bureau of Prisons records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, primarily documenting the events of July 23, 2019, when Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a rope around his neck. It includes staff shift logs, medical encounter reports for Epstein and his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione, photo sheets, an administrative detention order, and an incident report classifying the event as a possible suicide attempt/self-mutilation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate at the center of the incident report. Found with an orange cloth around his neck in his cell, reported as a possible suicide attempt. Later alleged his cellmate tried to kill and extort him.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate. Initially reported finding Epstein with a noose. Later, Epstein accused him of attempted murder, harassment, and extortion.

persons.name: W. MI
persons.context: A Senior Officer Specialist who responded to the incident on the Special Housing Unit, observed Epstein with the cloth around his neck, and called for assistance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary inmate found in his cell with a rope around his neck on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM. He was placed on suicide watch and examined by medical staff.

persons.name: Nicholas John Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate in SHU cell 124. He alerted staff to the incident involving Epstein and was later examined by medical staff.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: The medical provider who examined Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019, at 06:20, documenting his injuries and statements.

persons.name: PA-C
persons.context: The medical provider who examined inmate Nicholas Tartaglione on July 31, 2019, in the Special Housing Unit.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: A correctional supervisor involved in the incident response, authorizing administrative detention and appearing on photo sheets.

persons.name: Captain
persons.context: Appears as a signatory on the staff shift recap sheet.

connections.description: Were housed together in cell Z05-124LAD in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Epstein later accused Tartaglione of attempted murder and extortion.
Senior Officer Specialist W. MI was among the responding staff who found Epstein in his cell and assisted in the incident response.
Were housed together in Special Housing Unit cell 124 at the time of the incident on July 23, 2019.
MLP conducted the medical examination of Epstein following the incident, documenting his injuries and statements.
PA-C conducted a medical evaluation of Tartaglione on July 31, 2019, following the incident with his cellmate.
The Lieutenant was involved in the official response to the incident, including authorizing Epstein's placement in administrative detention and overseeing photo documentation.

events.title: Epstein's Possible Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, a call for assistance was made on the Special Housing Unit. Staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein on the floor of his cell with an orange homemade cloth/noose around his neck. He was breathing but unresponsive initially. He was removed from his cell, placed on a stretcher, taken to the HA-Unit, dressed in a suicide smock, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Alleges Cellmate Attempted Murder and Extortion
events.description: After becoming responsive, Epstein told staff he believed his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, tried to kill him. He also alleged Tartaglione had been trying to extort money from him for a week, threatening to beat him up if he didn't pay, and claimed Tartaglione said staff would not report a beating due to Epstein's charges.

events.title: Medical Examination of Epstein
events.description: Upon the arrival of medical staff (an MLP - Mid-Level Practitioner), Epstein was examined and treated for a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck with marks of friction, and a small erythema on his left knee.

events.title: Epstein Found with Rope in Cell
events.description: Staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein in SHU cell 124 with an orange homemade rope around his neck. He was breathing but unresponsive. His cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, alerted staff.

events.title: Epstein Medical Examination
events.description: MLP examined Epstein following the incident. Epstein claimed he did not know what happened, had a circular erythema (redness) on his neck, and was placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: An order was issued to place Jeffrey Epstein in Administrative Detention at MCC New York, pending classification.

events.title: Tartaglione Medical Evaluation
events.description: PA-C evaluated inmate Nicholas Tartaglione in the SHU. Tartaglione stated he felt good, had no acute complaints, and denied knowledge or involvement in the incident with his cellmate.

events.title: Incident Report Filed for Self-Mutilation
events.description: An official Bureau of Prisons Incident Report was filed, classifying the event with Epstein as 'Self-Mutilation' under prohibited act code 228.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Special Housing Unit (SHU), 9 SOUTH SHU, M Tier, Cell Z05-124LAD
HA-Unit (likely Health Services or Holding Area Unit)
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York, N.Y.
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his MCC cell with an orange homemade cloth/noose around his neck, in an incident reported as a possible suicide attempt.
Epstein later alleged to staff that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had tried to kill him and had been attempting to extort money from him for a week, threatening physical violence.

Epstein stated he had only informed his attorney about the alleged threats and extortion attempts by Tartaglione, not prison staff, because he was told staff would not report an assault due to his charges.
Medical examination after the incident found a circular red line with friction marks on Epstein's neck and a small red mark on his left knee.
The document includes multiple staff memoranda providing slightly different but consistent accounts of the initial response and Epstein's subsequent allegations.

On July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his SHU cell (124) with an orange homemade rope around his neck, in an incident classified as a possible suicide attempt/self-mutilation.
Epstein's cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, was the one who alerted staff to the incident. Tartaglione later told medical staff he had 'no idea what was going on' and denied any injury.

A medical exam hours after the incident found Epstein with a circular line of erythema (redness) around his neck but noted he was 'smiling during this clinical encounter' and repeatedly said 'I don't know' when asked about the marks.
Official documents show Epstein had been placed in Administrative Detention on July 10, 2019, pending classification, for his own protection.
The Bureau of Prisons Incident Report formally charged Epstein with the prohibited act of 'Self-Mutilation' (Code 228) following the event.
